member.name: IDCompositionShadowEffect.SetStandardDeviation
member.summary: Sets the amount of blur to be applied to the alpha channel of the image.
member.param: The amount of blur to be applied to the alpha channel of the image. You can compute the blur radius of the kernel by multiplying the standard deviation by 3. The units of both the standard deviation and blur radius are DIPs.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IDCompositionShadowEffect
member.summary: The shadow effect is used to generate a shadow from the alpha channel of an image. The shadow is more opaque for higher alpha values and more transparent for lower alpha values. You can set the amount of blur and the color of the shadow.
